verse.name: c1
verse.lines: So I'll cherish the old rugged cross, newline Till my trophies at last I lay down; newline I will cling to the old rugged cross, newline And exchange it some day for a crown.

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: On a hill far away newline Stood an old rugged cross; newline The emblem of suffering and shame. newline And I love that old cross newline Where the dearest and best, newline For a world of lost sinners was slain.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Oh, that old rugged cross, newline So despised by the world, newline Has a wondrous attraction for me; newline For the dear Lamb of God, newline Left His glory above, newline To bear it to dark Calvary.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: In the old rugged cross, newline Stained with blood so divine, newline A wondrous beauty I see; newline For 'twas on that old cross, newline Jesus suffered and died, newline To pardon and sanctify me.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: To the old rugged cross newline I will ever be true, newline It's shame and reproach gladly bear; newline Then He'll call me some day newline To my home far away, newline Where His glory forever I'll share.
